title: 1  Mouse/Trackpad Skills (timed)
text:
Tasks
Try these tasks again with only your keyboard. As with most tasks, these are faster with a keyboard. They can be completed 10 seconds or less.

title: 1  Mouse/Trackpad Skills (timed)
text:
Using only your mouse/trackpad, highlight, cut, and paste the underlined words in this sentence.
Using only your mouse/trackpad, highlight, cut, and paste this entire sentence.

title: 4  Organization within a Document (untimed)
text:
If you cannot see a navigation pane in the left hand panel of your Word document or Google Doc, change the settings so you can see the outline.
Using only your keyboard, create a heading in your document and the navigation pane.
Using only your keyboard, remove a heading that appears in the outline without changing any visible text in the document.

title: 3  Folder and File Management (untimed)
text:
In your Finder (Mac) or File Explorer (PC), create a new folder using only your keyboard.
Do the following without using the context menu (right click). Deselect the folder. Reselect it. Now access the renaming function using your keyboard or mouse/trackpad. Use your keyboard to rename the folder “random name.”
With only your keyboard, open a new Finder (Mac) or File Explorer (PC) window.
Verify

you have a logical folder structure. If you are a student or faculty, it may resemble this one. 
your files are mostly in reasonable locations. They should be in your “Documents” folder unless you have a strong reason to keep them elsewhere. They should not live in your “Downloads” folder.
your most commonly accessed folders are in your Quick access/Favorites menu.











Mac







PC
